It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1825 Nov. 1
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Tuesday November 1, 1825 session of court. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: Tuesday 1st of November
div.p:
Court convened agreeable to adjournment Present their Honors John Martin
&C et cetera Jurors
G. George Saunders
Fore Foreman

It is the opinion of the Jury that John Walker snr senior
shall pay Betsey Broon for her negroe negro . G. Saunders, Fore
Judgement in favor of Jackson & McConnel against Bridge Maker & wife by default $19.12 Â½
Judgement against Taylor Eldridge & William Blythe in favor of Jacob Seabolt, by default $51.75
Judgement in favor of Horsefly against John Spears by default
Court is adjourned untill until tomorrow 10 Oclock
